elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Test your knowledge on the subject of "screenplays".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Which statement is true?
choices: A screenplay is used as a planning document for the film shoot.
A script contains all the details of the actors' props.
A script contains all the dialog and action sequences.
The script serves as a checklist for the film shoot.
elements.correctAnswer: A script contains all the dialog and action sequences.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: A screenplay is generally only created for small and inexpensive productions. True or false?

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Which statement is true?
choices: The storyboard focuses on the dialog.
The script mainly provides information about the music and sound effects.
Screenplay is actually just another term for storyboard.
The screenplay is the written narrative of the story that the movie is supposed to tell.
elements.correctAnswer: The screenplay is the written narrative of the story that the movie is supposed to tell.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Test your knowledge on the subject of "screenplays".

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What are the most important elements that should be in a screenplay?
elements.correctAnswer: Plot of the story, all dialogs, place and time information, characters

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Do technical specifications for the cameraman belong in a script?
elements.correctAnswer: No, not as a rule. This information can be found in the storyboard or in the shot list.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: What is the difference between a storyboard and a screenplay?
elements.correctAnswer: The storyboard is the visualization of the plot, which is particularly important for camera operators. The script is the purely textual description of the plot.
